intro: Desmostachys planchonianus f. mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte starling, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. The species is of particular interest due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
